channel.title: AI Unfiltered
channel.description: Chinese AI • Open Source • Security • Incidents. Signal, not noise.

item.title: Google Gemini Prompt Injection Flaw Exposed Private Calendar Data via Malicious Invites
item.description: Cybersecurity researchers have disclosed details of a security flaw that leverages indirect prompt injection targeting Google Gemini as a way to bypass authorization guardrails and use Google Calendar as a data extraction mechanism. The vulnerability, Miggo Security's Head of Research, Liad...

item.title: TP-Link Patches Vulnerability Exposing VIGI Cameras to Remote Hacking
item.description: The researcher who discovered the vulnerability saw more than 2,500 internet-exposed devices. The post TP-Link Patches Vulnerability Exposing VIGI Cameras to Remote Hacking appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Jordanian Admits in US Court to Selling Access to 50 Enterprise Networks
item.description: Operating as an access broker, the defendant sold unauthorized access to compromised networks to an undercover agent. The post Jordanian Admits in US Court to Selling Access to 50 Enterprise Networks appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: The Download: the US digital rights crackdown, and AI companionship
item.description: This is today’s edition of The Download, our weekday newsletter that provides a daily dose of what’s going on in the world of technology. What it’s like to be banned from the US for fighting online hate Just before Christmas the Trump administration dramatically escalated its...

item.title: ‘SolyxImmortal’ Information Stealer Emerges
item.description: The information stealer abuses legitimate APIs and libraries to exfiltrate data to Discord webhooks. The post ‘SolyxImmortal’ Information Stealer Emerges appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Cyber Insights 2026: Information Sharing
item.description: Information sharing is necessary for efficient cybersecurity, and is widespread; but never quite perfect in practice. The post Cyber Insights 2026: Information Sharing appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: ⚡ Weekly Recap: Fortinet Exploits, RedLine Clipjack, NTLM Crack, Copilot Attack & More
item.description: In cybersecurity, the line between a normal update and a serious incident keeps getting thinner. Systems that once felt reliable are now under pressure from constant change. New AI tools, connected devices, and automated systems quietly create more ways in, often faster than security teams can...

item.title: New Reports Reinforce Cyberattack’s Role in Maduro Capture Blackout
item.description: US officials told The New York Times that cyberattacks were used to turn off the lights in Caracas and disrupt air defense radars. The post New Reports Reinforce Cyberattack’s Role in Maduro Capture Blackout appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Going beyond pilots with composable and sovereign AI
item.description: Today marks an inflection point for enterprise AI adoption. Despite billions invested in generative AI, only 5% of integrated pilots deliver measurable business value and nearly one in two companies abandons AI initiatives before reaching production. The bottleneck is not the models themselves....

item.title: DevOps & SaaS Downtime: The High (and Hidden) Costs for Cloud-First Businesses
item.description: Just a few years ago, the cloud was touted as the “magic pill” for any cyber threat or performance issue. Many were lured by the “always-on” dream, trading granular control for the convenience of managed services. In recent years, many of us have learned (often the hard way) that public cloud...

item.title: New StackWarp Hardware Flaw Breaks AMD SEV-SNP Protections on Zen 1–5 CPUs
item.description: A team of academics from the CISPA Helmholtz Center for Information Security in Germany has disclosed the details of a new hardware vulnerability affecting AMD processors. The security flaw, codenamed StackWarp, can allow bad actors with privileged control over a host server to run malicious code...

item.title: What it’s like to be banned from the US for fighting online hate
item.description: It was early evening in Berlin, just a day before Christmas Eve, when Josephine Ballon got an unexpected email from US Customs and Border Protection. The status of her ability to travel to the United States had changed—she’d no longer be able to enter the country.  At first, she couldn’t find...

item.title: CrashFix Chrome Extension Delivers ModeloRAT Using ClickFix-Style Browser Crash Lures
item.description: Cybersecurity researchers have disclosed details of an ongoing campaign dubbed KongTuke that used a malicious Google Chrome extension masquerading as an ad blocker to deliberately crash the web browser and trick victims into running arbitrary commands using ClickFix-like lures to deliver a...

item.title: Alibaba Health Launches “Hydrogen Ion,” an AI Assistant Designed for Clinicians
item.description: Alibaba Health has launched 'Hydrogen Ion', an evidence-based medical AI assistant aimed at clinicians, positioning it as a low-hallucination alternative to OpenEvidence for China’s healthcare system.

item.title: J&T Express and SF Holding Agree on Cross-Shareholding, Reshaping the Global Logistics Landscape
item.description: J&T Express and SF Holding have agreed to a USD 1.06 billion cross-shareholding deal to jointly build a more resilient global logistics network for cross-border e-commerce and Chinese firms going overseas.

item.title: Beijing Hyundai to Introduce Advanced Driver Assistance with Momenta Partnership
item.description: Beijing Hyundai is partnering with Momenta to roll out highway and urban NOA features as part of a broader localization push centered on smart and electric vehicles starting in 2026.

item.title: Li Auto Reshuffles Foundation Model Strategy, Integrates VLA Development Under New Leadership
item.description: Li Auto has elevated VLA to a company-level foundation model, consolidating VLA research under new leadership to anchor its embodied AI strategy beyond autonomous driving.

item.title: Baidu’s Apollo Go Launches Largest Fully Driverless Commercial Robotaxi Operation in Abu Dhabi
item.description: Apollo Go has officially launched its first overseas fully driverless robotaxi service in Abu Dhabi, aiming to build the city’s largest autonomous fleet by 2026.

item.title: Japanese AI Agent System on Human Papillomavirus Vaccination: System Design
item.description: arXiv:2601.10718v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Human papillomavirus (HPV) vaccine hesitancy poses significant public health challenges, particularly in Japan where proactive vaccination recommendations were suspended from 2013 to 2021. The resulting information gap is exacerbated by misinformation...

item.title: Do You Trust Me? Cognitive-Affective Signatures of Trustworthiness in Large Language Models
item.description: arXiv:2601.10719v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Perceived trustworthiness underpins how users navigate online information, yet it remains unclear whether large language models (LLMs),increasingly embedded in search, recommendation, and conversational systems, represent this construct in...

item.title: Building AI Agents to Improve Job Referral Requests to Strangers
item.description: arXiv:2601.10726v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: This paper develops AI agents that help job seekers write effective requests for job referrals in a professional online community. The basic workflow consists of an improver agent that rewrites the referral request and an evaluator agent that measures...

item.title: ORBITFLOW: SLO-Aware Long-Context LLM Serving with Fine-Grained KV Cache Reconfiguration
item.description: arXiv:2601.10729v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Serving long-context LLMs is challenging because request lengths and batch composition vary during token generation, causing the memory footprint to fluctuate significantly at runtime. Offloading KV caches to host memory limits effective memory usage,...

item.title: CTHA: Constrained Temporal Hierarchical Architecture for Stable Multi-Agent LLM Systems
item.description: arXiv:2601.10738v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Recently, multi-time-scale agent architectures have extended the ubiquitous single-loop paradigm by introducing temporal hierarchies with distinct cognitive layers. While yielding substantial performance gains, this diversification fundamentally...

item.title: Analytic Bijections for Smooth and Interpretable Normalizing Flows
item.description: arXiv:2601.10774v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: A key challenge in designing normalizing flows is finding expressive scalar bijections that remain invertible with tractable Jacobians. Existing approaches face trade-offs: affine transformations are smooth and analytically invertible but lack...

item.title: Unified Optimization of Source Weights and Transfer Quantities in Multi-Source Transfer Learning: An Asymptotic Framework
item.description: arXiv:2601.10779v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Transfer learning plays a vital role in improving model performance in data-scarce scenarios. However, naive uniform transfer from multiple source tasks may result in negative transfer, highlighting the need to properly balance the contributions of...

item.title: Towards Tensor Network Models for Low-Latency Jet Tagging on FPGAs
item.description: arXiv:2601.10801v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We present a systematic study of Tensor Network (TN) models $\unicode{x2013}$ Matrix Product States (MPS) and Tree Tensor Networks (TTN) $\unicode{x2013}$ for real-time jet tagging in high-energy physics, with a focus on low-latency deployment on...

item.title: Digital Metabolism: Decoupling Logic from Facts via Regenerative Unlearning -- Towards a Pure Neural Logic Core
item.description: arXiv:2601.10810v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Large language models (LLMs) currently suffer from parameter entanglement, where general reasoning capabilities (logic) and specific factual knowledge (facts) exist in a superposition state within shared weights. This coupling leads to the "memory...

item.title: Towards Reliable ML Feature Engineering via Planning in Constrained-Topology of LLM Agents
item.description: arXiv:2601.10820v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Recent advances in code generation models have unlocked unprecedented opportunities for automating feature engineering, yet their adoption in real-world ML teams remains constrained by critical challenges: (i) the scarcity of datasets capturing the...

item.title: LLMs for Game Theory: Entropy-Guided In-Context Learning and Adaptive CoT Reasoning
item.description: arXiv:2601.10775v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We propose a novel LLM-based framework for reasoning in discrete, game-theoretic tasks, illustrated with \emph{Tic-Tac-Toe}. The method integrates in-context learning with entropy-guided chain-of-thought (CoT) reasoning and adaptive context retrieval....

item.title: BYOL: Bring Your Own Language Into LLMs
item.description: arXiv:2601.10804v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Large Language Models (LLMs) exhibit strong multilingual capabilities, yet remain fundamentally constrained by the severe imbalance in global language resources. While over 7,000 languages are spoken worldwide, only a small subset (fewer than 100) has...

item.title: A Concise Agent is Less Expert: Revealing Side Effects of Using Style Features on Conversational Agents
item.description: arXiv:2601.10809v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Style features such as friendly, helpful, or concise are widely used in prompts to steer the behavior of Large Language Model (LLM) conversational agents, yet their unintended side effects remain poorly understood. In this work, we present the first...

item.title: Reasoning Models Generate Societies of Thought
item.description: arXiv:2601.10825v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Large language models have achieved remarkable capabilities across domains, yet mechanisms underlying sophisticated reasoning remain elusive. Recent reasoning models outperform comparable instruction-tuned models on complex cognitive tasks, attributed...

item.title: EncodeRec: An Embedding Backbone for Recommendation Systems
item.description: arXiv:2601.10837v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Recent recommender systems increasingly leverage embeddings from large pre-trained language models (PLMs). However, such embeddings exhibit two key limitations: (1) PLMs are not explicitly optimized to produce structured and discriminative embedding...

item.title: Disruption with some GitHub services
item.description: Jan 17, 01:28 UTCUpdate - Deployment of the fix is in progress. We are still targetting 2:00 AM UTC for full resolution.Jan 17, 00:08 UTCUpdate - Some enterprise Copilot CLI users may encounter an "You are not authorized to use this Copilot feature" error. We have identified the root cause and are...

item.title: Building Production-Ready Probes For Gemini
item.description: Frontier language model capabilities are improving rapidly. We thus need stronger mitigations against bad actors misusing increasingly powerful systems. Prior work has shown that activation probes may be a promising misuse mitigation technique, but we identify a key remaining challenge: probes fail...

item.title: ShapeR: Robust Conditional 3D Shape Generation from Casual Captures
item.description: Recent advances in 3D shape generation have achieved impressive results, but most existing methods rely on clean, unoccluded, and well-segmented inputs. Such conditions are rarely met in real-world scenarios. We present ShapeR, a novel approach for conditional 3D object shape generation from...

item.title: The Poisoned Apple Effect: Strategic Manipulation of Mediated Markets via Technology Expansion of AI Agents
item.description: The integration of AI agents into economic markets fundamentally alters the landscape of strategic interaction. We investigate the economic implications of expanding the set of available technologies in three canonical game-theoretic settings: bargaining (resource division), negotiation (asymmetric...

item.title: The Download: cut through AI coding hype, and biotech trends to watch
item.description: This is today’s edition of The Download, our weekday newsletter that provides a daily dose of what’s going on in the world of technology. AI coding is now everywhere. But not everyone is convinced. Depending who you ask, AI-powered coding is either giving software developers...

item.title: Issue with Ruleset Modification Audit Logs
item.description: Jan 16, 10:42 UTCInvestigating - Cloudflare is investigating an issue where some audit logs for ruleset modifications are not appearing in the Dashboard. We are working to resolve the issue. More updates to follow shortly.

item.title: AstroReason-Bench: Evaluating Unified Agentic Planning across Heterogeneous Space Planning Problems
item.description: Recent advances in agentic Large Language Models (LLMs) have positioned them as generalist planners capable of reasoning and acting across diverse tasks. However, existing agent benchmarks largely focus on symbolic or weakly grounded environments, leaving their performance in physics-constrained...

item.title: Three technologies that will shape biotech in 2026
item.description: Earlier this week, MIT Technology Review published its annual list of Ten Breakthrough Technologies. As always, it features technologies that made the news last year, and which—for better or worse—stand to make waves in the coming years. They’re the technologies you should really be paying...

item.title: Language of Thought Shapes Output Diversity in Large Language Models
item.description: Output diversity is crucial for Large Language Models as it underpins pluralism and creativity. In this work, we reveal that controlling the language used during model thinking-the language of thought-provides a novel and structural source of output diversity. Our preliminary study shows that...

A detailed root cause analysis will be shared as soon as it is available.Jan 15, 18:54 UTCUpdate - Pull Requests is operating normally.Jan 15, 18:42 UTCUpdate -...

item.title: Introducing OptiMind, a research model designed for optimization
Cloudflare Dashboard and Cloudflare API service issues
item.description: Jan 15, 18:00 UTCResolved - Customers may have been logged out from the Dashboard and had issues logging in between 17:45 - 17:56 UTC. Additionally, there would have been an increased 403 and 500 rate for services (such as Zaraz).
